summary.text: the separator to use for string arrays
the initial search string (e.g. ?query=test), contains the questionsmark
will delete all namespaces and remove the history listener

Creates a flat serializable object based on a mapping Object
that can be used to generate a query string.

content.text: a key/value object with the object containing the defined parameters as key.

#  Geschichte (/t/)

(german for History / Story / Tale) Let's you manage query-parameters with hooks.
Uses

to manage the internal state.

Documentation & Demo: https://bowlingx.github.io/geschichte/index.html

API: https://bowlingx.github.io/geschichte/api/index.html

    yarn add geschichte

    npm install geschichte

## Basic Example

let's you describe and serialize an arbitrary object of any depth to your browsers query and history.
It takes care of updating the next state and current query in a efficient way using

.
It works on both the browser and server side (with

, so I picked a fitting german name :).

## Agenda

- Add more tests
- Propper examples and documentation of the full API
- Describe Use-Cases

## Compability

It works out of the box with react-router (by providing the same

instance).

### Using with next.js

Nextjs support is build in, but requires a different Adapter.
